intro: Manfreda virginica, commonly known as the Virginica manfreda, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to the southwestern United States. It is a succulent plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Manfreda virginica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
